did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Collection of Books About Hollywood (Los Angeles, Calif.) in Literature,

repository.label: Repository

did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact the UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Advance notice required for access.

altformavail.head: Additional Physical Form Available
altformavail.p: A copy of the original version of this online finding aid is available at the UCLA Department of Special Collections for in-house consultation and may be obtained for a fee. Please contact:

list.item: UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections
Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Collection of Books About Hollywood (Los Angeles, Calif.) in Literature (Collection 348). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of 251 books about Hollywood or having a Hollywood locale. The collection is chiefly fiction but includes some non-fiction, exposés and biographies. Includes Victor Appleton's Tom Swift and His Wizard Camera (c. 1912), Mary Astor's My Story (1960), Henry Farrell's Whatever happened to Baby Jane? (c. 1960), Christopher Isherwood's Prater Violet (c. 1945), Arthur Miller's The Misfits (1961), and Irving Shulman's Harlow, an Intimate Biography (c. 1964).

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

p.emph: Description derived from in-house card file.

did.unittitle: Hollywood literature. A Collection of books about Hollywood [v.p., v.d.]

scopecontent.p: The collection is chiefly fiction but includes some non-fiction, exposés and biographies. About half of the collections consists of paper-backs.
A card file is in a drawer in the Numbered Collections Catalog.
The core collection has been enlarged to include general books with Hollywood locale.
